The Advent Children HD will be released as "Final Fantasy VII : Advent Children Complete" on the Blu-ray Disc in 2008

because a DVD doesn't have enough capacity for full HD quality movie - This download is small enough for a dvd because it's compressed in XviD, but in raw format you need a larger storage media, e.g. Blu-ray

SVENSK SUBTITLE:

To anybody who is interested, this film plays quite well using XBMC on an Xbox 1 and looks beautiful. The only problem is that the subtitles are not being played whenever the DVDplayer core is used, and playback is to slow using the Mplayer core. If anyone figures out a workaround please let us know. Also, I had to split the file in two to overcome the 4gb file limitation.

And to those naysayers (oggign, I'm looking at you) who are saying that this isn't in HD please download the file before throwing around accusations. There is no f*cking way that this is upscaled material. Only a blind fool would think that this is not an HD rip - it looks f*cking amazing!

English subs:

http://www.opensubtitles.org/en/subtitles/3103638/final-fantasy-vii-advent-children-en

@crazyteknohed: No offence, but plz consider this fact before you swear : How the hell can a HDrip be available if the HD source is not exist?
Check this link, dude : http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Final_Fantasy_VII_Advent_Children (go to Special Editions section).
And let's face it, although this realease look amazing compared to DVD quality, there's a long long way ahead compared to a real HD quality. Just check out Cars or Kung Fu Panda realeases in 720p or 1080p, the differences are clearly visible.
BTW, thanks to the uploader, though I didn't download this.

Oggin, it's quite simple - an HD rip can exist without the HD source apparently exisiting in the same way that all th axxo DVD rips exist without the DVD sources existing. People here seem so have the means for obtaining the unobtainable.

Besides, this release is an HDTV rip, not BR/HD-DVD rip, so I don't see where your argument is? I can see why you are arguing that it's an upscaled DVD as the caps are a bit crap. But hey, I can't force anyone to download this, nor do I care if they do or don't, I just wanted to vouch for the uploader. Some of us appreciate the work they do ;)
